dcterms:creator: K. Maekawa
M. Asahara
T. Ogiso
T. Maruyama
H. Ogura
W. Kashino
H. Koiso
M. Yamaguchi
M. Tanaka
Y. Den
dcterms:description: The Balanced Corpus of Contemporary Written Japanese (BCCWJ) is a balanced corpus composed of 100 million Japanese words randomly sampled from various text genres, annotated with rich linguistic information including part-of-speech, document structure, meta-information, and more.
dcterms:title: Balanced Corpus of Contemporary Written Japanese (BCCWJ)

dcterms:creator: A. Kennedy
J. Pynte
dcterms:description: The Dundee Corpus is a famous eye-tracking corpus composed of 20 English newspaper articles experimentally annotated with eye-tracking data collected from 10 English and 10 French participants.
dcterms:title: Dundee Corpus

dcterms:creator: R. Kliegl
A. Nuthmann
R. Engbert
dcterms:description: The Potsdam Sentence Corpus is an eye-tracking corpus composed of 144 German independent sentences manually edited to contain low-frequency syntactic constructions, experimentally annotated with eye-tracking data collected from 222 participants.
dcterms:title: Potsdam Sentence Corpus

dcterms:creator: R. Futrell
E. Gibson
H. Tily
I. Blank
A. Vishnevetsky
S. Piantadosi
E. Fedorenko
dcterms:description: The Natural Stories Corpus is a corpus of 10 English stories manually edited to contain low-frequency syntactic constructions, annotated with self-paced reading data collected from 19 participants, and also annotated with fMRI data collected from 78 participants.
dcterms:title: Natural Stories Corpus

dcterms:creator: U. Cop
N. Dirix
D. Drieghe
W. Duyck
dcterms:description: The Ghent Eye-Tracking Corpus (GECO) consists of the English novel 'The Mysterious Affair at Styles' by Agatha Christie, experimentally annotated with eye-tracking data collected from 14 English native speakers and 19 Dutch-English bilingual speakers.
dcterms:title: Ghent Eye-Tracking Corpus (GECO)

dcterms:creator: S. L. Frank
L. J. Otten
G. Galli
G. Vigliocco
dcterms:description: The UCL Corpus is an EEG corpus composed of 205 English independent sentences experimentally annotated with EEG data collected from 24 participants.
dcterms:title: UCL Corpus

dcterms:creator: J. Brennan
J. Hale
dcterms:description: The Alice Corpus consists of the first chapter of the English story 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland' read by Kristen McQuillan, experimentally annotated with EEG data collected from 52 participants.
dcterms:title: Alice Corpus

dcterms:creator: N. Hollenstein
J. Rotsztejn
M. Troendle
A. Pedroni
C. Zhang
N. Langer
dcterms:description: The Zurich Cognitive Language Processing Corpus (ZuCo) consists of about 1000 English independent sentences from the Stanford Sentiment Treebank and Wikipedia relation extraction corpus, experimentally annotated with simultaneously recorded EEG and eye-tracking data collected from 12 participants.
dcterms:title: Zurich Cognitive Language Processing Corpus (ZuCo)

dcterms:creator: M. Asahara
S. Yasuda
H. Konishi
M. Imada
K. Maekawa
dcterms:description: BCCWJ-EyeTrack is an eye-tracking corpus composed of 20 Japanese newspaper articles selected from BCCWJ, experimentally annotated with eye-tracking and self-paced reading data collected from 24 participants.
dcterms:title: BCCWJ-EyeTrack

dcterms:creator: M. Asahara
H. Ono
E. Miyamoto
dcterms:description: BCCWJ-EEG is the EEG corpus designed in this paper, composed of the same set of 20 Japanese newspaper articles experimentally annotated with EEG data collected from 40 participants.
dcterms:title: BCCWJ-EEG
